channel.title: Few questions regarding Xbox 360
channel.description: Okay, I'm contemplating buying a few things. But first I need to work out a few things: 1) Is using a Wireless networking adapter for the 360 going to be slower than using an Ethernet cord? 2) Is the wireless headset better than the wired headset? Apparently the sound is a lot clearer on the wireless one.

item.title: Few questions regarding Xbox 360
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer

[/quote]
Yah, I agree.
We should just sell Ayers Rock, some Roo’s and the Solar energy we get from the mass amount of sun exposure for some decent internet.

builds Ethernet cable from Netherlands to Australia[/quote]
Haha, that would be own.

item.title: Few questions regarding Xbox 360
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:16, topic:248314”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=327353.msg2564088#msg2564088 date=1228318106]
Do you guys live in the outback or something?

Fucking hell, in the Netherlands everyone is getting fiberglas cables in a few years. For free!
[/quote]

Yeh Virgin are doing that around our area, I have it at my dads house it’s ownage. 5mb/Second downloads are nice tyvm… too bad only torrent seem to download that fast.

BTW Yz, how are you currently connecting your xbox to the internet?[/quote]
Phone line socket -> Belkin router -> xbox 360. The main problem why I was thinking use a wireless was less clutter in my room.

Read full topic

item.title: Few questions regarding Xbox 360
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:20, topic:248314”][quote author=goatee link=topic=327353.msg2564190#msg2564190 date=1228323028]

Fucking hell, in the Netherlands everyone is getting fiberglas cables in a few years. For free!

Uhm, no you’re not. They don’t make fibreglass cables.

I knew what he meant, as did everyone else who isn’t retarded.
[/quote]

Ah but, if I didn’t make a correction, the people who are retarded may have come away a little bit dumber.

It was nothing personal, but you know as well as I do how many retards read these forums.[/quote]

It’s my fault though. In Dutch it’s ‘glasvezel’: glas = glass, vezel = fiber. So that way it would be glassfiber, which was wrong according to FF’s spell checker so it became fiberglass.

Read full topic

item.title: Few questions regarding Xbox 360
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:12, topic:248314”][quote author=thefalloffuckingtroy. link=topic=327353.msg2563668#msg2563668 date=1228273023]
I have both kinds of headsets, the wired ones are easier and its easier for everybody to hear you unless you buy a huge ass wireless headset that comes down close to your mouth. And for ethernet, Wireless is a pain in the ass, you always have to reset everything if you unplug the connector and i always used to loose connection because i have thick walls in my house. Wired is so much easier, but i don’t think there is any difference in speed but make sure you have a lot of bandwidth or else it will be like shit, when i went over bandwidth on my 360 it used to knock out all the internet in my house and i’d have to reset the modem.
[/quote]
The problem between you and I, is that I have without a doubt the worst internet in the world. I normally become capped after 2 weeks of reset, with only a 2gb download limit. I’ll just stick to wired, apparently from what I have heard wireless isn’t worth it, in both situations.[/quote]
What the hell? That’s horrible internet.
Switch to Optus ADSL2.

I’m in Australia, have ADSL2 (only ever reached 1.5MB/s, though), and have a 30GB cap.

Read full topic

360 doesn’t use a crossover cable. Wireless headset microphone doesn’t pick up sound well, wired headset breaks all the time.

item.title: Few questions regarding Xbox 360
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

thefalloffuckingtroy.:

I have both kinds of headsets, the wired ones are easier and its easier for everybody to hear you unless you buy a huge ass wireless headset that comes down close to your mouth. And for ethernet, Wireless is a pain in the ass, you always have to reset everything if you unplug the connector and i always used to loose connection because i have thick walls in my house. Wired is so much easier, but i don’t think there is any difference in speed but make sure you have a lot of bandwidth or else it will be like shit, when i went over bandwidth on my 360 it used to knock out all the internet in my house and i’d have to reset the modem.

The problem between you and I, is that I have without a doubt the worst internet in the world. I normally become capped after 2 weeks of reset, with only a 2gb download limit. I’ll just stick to wired, apparently from what I have heard wireless isn’t worth it, in both situations.

Read full topic

I have both kinds of headsets, the wired ones are easier and its easier for everybody to hear you unless you buy a huge ass wireless headset that comes down close to your mouth. And for ethernet, Wireless is a pain in the ass, you always have to reset everything if you unplug the connector and i always used to loose connection because i have thick walls in my house. Wired is so much easier, but i don’t think there is any difference in speed but make sure you have a lot of bandwidth or else it will be like shit, when i went over bandwidth on my 360 it used to knock out all the internet in my house and i’d have to reset the modem.

item.title: Few questions regarding Xbox 360
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

since your 3m away, wired.

I got panasonic powerline adapters for $80 when the wireless adapter costs $100

I also saw a guide that said you can make your own wireless receiver by taking a linksys router and installing dd-wrt on it and doing some other things to it.

Read full topic

item.title: Few questions regarding Xbox 360
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Tico135, post:2, topic:248314”]1) Obviously it’s going to be slower, the further you are away, the less strength the signal is. What I do suggest, is save your money from the wireless adapter is: buy a crossover cable (looks like an Ethernet cable) which is about $15 and the wireless adapter is about $100. Seeing as you have/will get a laptop, plug one end of the crossover cable into the Ethernet slot, and the other end into your 360. Set your internet connection on your laptop to share, and you will be able to use xbox live via the crossover cable. It’s the same strength as your laptop would have.

  1. I would assume they are the same, wireless are expensive and can break really really easily.[/quote]Actually, it can be better, or worse.

If your laptop has a nice Wireless card (I know ThinkPads are well known for their’s), then the signal will be stronger as the Microsoft one is only average.

However, if your computer is doing a lot of internet related tasks (downloading etc) it will cause massive lagg for the 360.

I do it though.

Also, the mics are the same. I use a wired because it is more durable.

Read full topic
